alert.note: Alert for Meigs (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 9:58AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Meigs. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Streams remain high due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings may be inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 952 AM EST, gauge reports indicated high river levels. Flooding is ongoing from prior heavy rainfall. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area through this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tuppers Plains and Chester. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
